article.headline: Buffalo 68, Marshall 55
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (AP) -- Turner Battle scored 21 points to lead Buffalo to a 68-55 win over Marshall on Wednesday evening. Roderick Middleton scored all 14 of his points in the second half while Mark Bortz added 12 and a team-high eight rebounds for Buffalo (18-7, 10-6 Mid-American Conference). A.W. Hamilton's 12 points led three players in double figures for Marshall (5-19, 2-13). Tre Whitted and Mark Patton added 11 apiece in the loss. The win was the fifth straight for the Bulls, their longest streak of the season, while Marshall remains winless against teams for the MAC East division (0-7). Middleton scored eight points during a 15-6 run. A Middleton 3-pointer with 2:04 gave Buffalo its biggest lead at 67-51. Buffalo out-rebounded Marshall 41-29 and grabbed 19 offensive rebounds in the contest. Marshall had trouble finding the range early as the Bulls led the entire first half and went into the break 31-23.<

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
